thread.title: Four-star UGA pledge makes it official
thread.title_full: Four-star UGA pledge makes it official

title: Four-star UGA pledge makes it official
text:
Four-star UGA pledge makes it official Georgia has officially held on to a four-star defensive lineman in the 2017 class.   
ATHENS, Ga. -- Towers (Decatur, Ga.) defensive lineman Devonte Wyatt flirted with a pair of schools down the stretch but he's now officially a member of Georgia's 2017 class. UGA confirmed receipt of his National Letter of Intent just after 11 a.m. on Wednesday. 
Wyatt took official visits to South Carolina and Florida in January. Many felt that the Gamecocks, the program he was once committed to before flipping to UGA, had the best shot. Wyatt confirmed to Dawgs247 on Tuesday that he would indeed sign with the in-state program and made it official a day later.
